title: Ranked Restrictions
body:
Hey all,

For a while now, the Competitive and Player Behavior teams have been working together to create features that foster both a fun and competitive environment in ranked play, and we recently tested a new feature on PBE. Known as Ranked Restrictions, the experiment restricted the in-game chat of negative players and prevented them from joining ranked queues until they’d completed the required number of games. With the feature proving successful on PBE, we’re rolling it out to live servers in NA and EUW in the coming days. Depending on the results of this, we’ll continue to add regions globally.

When Ranked Restrictions go live on NA and EU, restricted players will be unable to queue up for ranked until they complete a certain number of games in Normal Draft. One thing we specifically wanted to address is that Ranked Restricted players will be Chat Restricted in other queues, and they can and should still be reported if they continue to display negative behaviors while playing through their restrictions. As with Chat Restrictions, after they finish the predetermined number of games, we’ll perform a final evaluation to make sure they've actually improved their in-game behavior. Players who haven’t shown improvement will continue to be restricted from playing ranked. Related to Ranked Restrictions, we’ve determined that Ranked Rewards should reward positive sportsmanship just as much as they reward great play, so the most negative players who are Ranked or Chat Restricted at the end of the season will be ineligible to earn ranked end of season rewards such as the loading screen borders or Victorious Morgana champion skin. While the majority of players will not be affected by this ruling, we wanted to message it well in advance so that players concerned about their behavior have more than enough time to adjust and reform before the end of the season.

-Riot Socrates

*Update 9/24 - Hey all, thanks for all the feedback on this. Wanted to further clarify a few points that I saw come up

**Q: Will all chat and ranked restricted players be ineligible for rewards at the end of the season?**
A: No, of the chat and ranked restricted players the ones with the worst behavioral records will not earn rewards.

**Q: Do you expect to see the quality of normal draft decline from this?**
A. We see that a players behavior shifts pretty dramatically based on the queue they are playing in. Since normals are less stressful and players who receive ranked restrictions will also receive chat restrictions, we don't expect to see an impact to the quality of the queue. That said, we'll be closely monitoring the health of the queue to ensure there isn't a negative impact.

**Q: Won't these players just feed, troll, and AFK their way through the games?**
A: Players have to win a certain number of games to lift the restrictions, so this would work against them. Also we'll reassess players as they near completion of their ranked restriction games. If we still see a pattern of negative behavior, the restrictions will be reinforced.

**Q: Can players decay while they are ranked restricted.**
A: Yes.

replies.body:
As someone who mostly plays Normal Draft, thanks for shoving all the assholes over to my preferred queue, Riot!

I don't have a problem with preventing them from getting ranked rewards, but seriously? I don't like blind pick or team builder, and I only play one ranked game a month to prevent decay. Am I just going to have to spam ARAMs to avoid the ragers?

> As someone who mostly plays Normal Draft, thanks for shoving all the assholes over to my preferred queue, Riot!
> 
> I don't have a problem with preventing them from getting ranked rewards, but seriously? I don't like blind pick or team builder, and I only play one ranked game a month to prevent decay. Am I just going to have to spam ARAMs to avoid the ragers?

How about shoving all of them into their own tier? They can still play Normal Blind Pick and Draft Normal as they can now - in other word's, It WOULDN'T be a prisoner's island since they are only barred from Ranked - but they will have to face each other and play "Toxic Tier" in order to be allowed to play Ranked again. If they refrain from raging against people who are as toxic as they are, they have without a doubt proven they are able to reform.

They won't do that as it creates the "prisoner island" concept that they have said before they are against. It's been mentioned before and the vast majority of people agree it's a good idea except for Riot so it's not happening

The problem is that now Normal Draft is prisoner's island. Team Builder and Normal Blind have no bans or ban phase, so there's no place to straight practice counterpicks and match ups without dropping straight in to ranked. You've sacrificed Normal Draft to improve the Ranked experience in a sense.

Riot has intentionally said they believe in a system that allows players to reform, and that they have data that shows a prisoner's island sort of scenario actually breeds more negativity than it solves.

Personally, I'm going to let the guys with people who make their living off of managing and forging communities and have tons of data and analytics to study make the informed decision rather than try to backseat drive.

> As someone who mostly plays Normal Draft, thanks for shoving all the assholes over to my preferred queue, Riot!
> 
> I don't have a problem with preventing them from getting ranked rewards, but seriously? I don't like blind pick or team builder, and I only play one ranked game a month to prevent decay. Am I just going to have to spam ARAMs to avoid the ragers?

We see that a players behavior shifts pretty dramatically based on the queue they are playing in. Since normals are less stressful and players who receive ranked restrictions will also receive chat restrictions, we don't expect to see an impact to the quality of the queue. That said, we'll be closely monitoring the health of the queue to ensure there isn't a negative impact.

Honestly as someone who is currently facing my 5th straight chat restriction that just hit 52 games I think you're just going to alienate a bunch of people who actually are passionate about climbing and playing League. I despise normal que's of all degrees because it promotes no growth in gameplay. You don't want prisoner's island, but you're going to negatively impact a bunch of games from people who don't like ranked by forcing someone like me, and many like me who don't like normals to play normals. You're better off banning for a week than doing something dumb like this, you're just going to fuel worse behavior. Because now we'll take out our frustration of having to play meaningless crap games that promote no skill growth because of troll picks and random bs like Fiddlesticks ADC. 

You want to reform people, throw out bans instead of excessively long chat restrictions. Why did I not reform? Because when I get reported I LOLOLOL I'm on my 6th straight and not banned. The chat restriction is a joke punishment, and a lot of us don't take it seriously. Sad part was, everytime it hit me I changed for a bit but due to personal life issues sometimes my ability to regulate my attitude is completely ruined. 

You're making a huge mistake with this change. I am more likely to uninstall the game than waste 50 games playing unranked. I am sure tons of people feel the same way. Also, a lot of us will resort to smurfs. Smurfing when pissed about restrictions ruins the gameplay for new players who can't properly play and draw our ire and anger. Seriously. I am looking out for Riot's best interest not my own. But unfortunately, seems too late for you guys to not do this.

Also, to confirm... if we have a 52 game chat restrict we have to play 52 normal draft games before being eligible to play ranked? Or you guys are giving a set amount of games we have to complete?

>The chat restriction is a joke punishment, and a lot of us don't take it seriously. Sad part was, everytime it hit me I changed for a bit but due to personal life issues sometimes my ability to regulate my attitude is completely ruined. 

Riot's stance on this is that we all have personal life issues, and as we don't want other people to burden us with these issues, they expect you to not push your issues onto these other people. League of Legends is a teambased game; if you're looking for a therapeutic experience try single player.

> 
> You're making a huge mistake with this change. I am more likely to uninstall the game than waste 50 games playing unranked. I am sure tons of people feel the same way.

As only 1% of people get hit with chat restrictions I'm sure the overal impact will be quite small, both in numbers and percentages.

>Also, a lot of us will resort to smurfs. Smurfing when pissed about restrictions ruins the gameplay for new players who can't properly play and draw our ire and anger.

Riot already does itentify smurfs. If you think they can't track them, let me tell you this: They don't only track IP adresses. Every client has it's own unique ID, which is partly generated from your unique Windows installation as well as what hardware is in your computer. Unless you wipe your hard drive and change the major components in your computer every time you switch to a smurf they will be able to detect you. For particularly egregious offenses they have been known to ban both people's main accounts and all of their smurfs.

But you're raising a valid point: If leveling a smurf is faster than finishing one's Ranked Restrictions, Riot should take steps to ensure the Ranked  Restricted players cannot open other accounts with the client they're using on their computer, and should Ranked Restrict all other accounts as well.

>Seriously. I am looking out for Riot's best interest not my own.

No words for this one...

My dear sir,

Your reply to this person made my tears well up with joy.

These restrictions are to not only shift the people who shouldn't be toxic in ranked, out of ranked. But also 
help in fostering a new appreciation for the game and its leisurely  nature in non-competitive (well technically competitive but not professional) arenas.


For all out there who read this I would like to say this:

If you play ranked with the notion you will become a professional then you should conduct yourself as a professional.
If you wish to be a toolbag then people will treat you as such. such is the circular nature of behaviour.
Act as you would wish to receive and the arenas in which we play will be as fun and exciting as I personally have found the game.
This appreciation will be absent however if you choose to ignore this simple fact and continue on to be a difficult and toxic person with the goal of shunting and ignoring the existence of other peoples growth and advancement. 

I personally have seen the growth of League of Legends and applaud every second that Riot spends into creating a better gaming environment and experience.

Thank-You Riot and Like minded gamers.

:D hope everyone can {{champion:13}}  to the occasion  :D

But some people, not me, atleast, might have per say, an older or younger brother or sister who play league on the same computer, so you can never be sure if it's actually a smurf, and your brother or sister can get you banned :(

If they're this young yet vicious enough to be a member of the 1% club, chances are they have no business being in the internet in the first place, yet alone playing LOL. Also, if you notice your sibling rages enough on the internet to get your account into trouble I would start by telling my parents and get them to seriously talk to my son/daughter about their anger management issues...

I'm happy that you have been able to come up with an idea that actually helps the players harassed or trolled in a game and not just punish the players that do have an negative attitude towards the game and it's players. Good job!
i'm just a negative person, what would happen if i were to go to ranked and won matches with a negative attitude such as "sorry guys, i'm not the best at gnar" (PENTA KILL) "that was an accident."

Sir. There is a big difference between being toxic and having low self-esteem. "All of you suck" is being toxic, and "Sorry, I'm not any good at Gnar" is having low self-esteem, lack of confidence in yourself.

> **When Ranked Restrictions go live on NA and EU, restricted players will be unable to queue up for ranked until they complete a certain number of games in Normal Draft. **

My life is complete.

Thank you based Rito.
1060 restrictions, just made gold 4, thanks riot. time to uninstall this game. i hope it will die soon!!

Read again, it says right there you just need to play a certain number of Draft Normal to work off the "no Ranked" penalty, nowhere it tells you to finish all your chat restrictions. It even says, if I read that correctly, that after those Draft Normals you won't have a chat restriction while playing ranked, only when you play non-Ranked games.

> Read again, it says right there you just need to play a certain number of Draft Normal to work off the "no Ranked" penalty, nowhere it tells you to finish all your chat restrictions. It even says, if I read that correctly, that after those Draft Normals you won't have a chat restriction while playing ranked, only when you play non-Ranked games.

for me it says that i get restrictions, like my 1075 (which i got randomly after 2 days, not even played so many games), and i have to play them ALL then before i can play ranked again. I´m not toxic, but saying something like stop these and better do that is reportable. Are you kidding me? League community is the worst. People get restrictions for playing, not even writing in chat, and now Riot comes with this. Please...^^
you do not get 1k chat restrictions by "not being toxic"

"i hope it will die soon!!"

Clearly not from an abitual rager

> you do not get 1k chat restrictions by "not being toxic"

This.

> People get restrictions for playing, not even writing in chat, and now Riot comes with this

Are you being completely serious right now, please go ask Riot to explain your bans/restrictions to you. I dare you.
Double dare.

They don't they just send you to a thread on the boards. I was well mannered and asked for an explanation cause I'm tired of getting banned just cause somebody way down the line took a word meaning a bundle of sticks and turned it into a homophobic slur. Can't we all agree that it doesn't even mean gay anymore and just means that I hate everything about you?

> Can't we all agree that it doesn't even mean gay anymore and just means that **I hate everything about you?**

I fail to see how that makes anything better, honestly.

> > Can't we all agree that it doesn't even mean gay anymore and just means that **I hate everything about you?**
> 
> I fail to see how that makes anything better, honestly.

Can we just savor this moment?

This is SO gonna be abused by lousy players-_-.  
If someone doesn't like you they're just gonna report you for being negative or toxic, and BAM! you're banned from ranked for a significant amount of time:/ However, as long as it's NOT abused this could be nice.
False reports do nothing. So just do nothing report worthy and you are fine.
In other words; don't be a dick.

I don't know if it's something the community wants, but would you consider making the Ranked Restricted player queue up ***solo*** for normal Draft in order to work off the games? I fear that if the player is able to queue up with a full premade with no chance of getting reported, they're really not going through the same trial as everyone else. It would not be so different from letting them play Co-op games or solo customs to work off the penalty. Anyone else agree to making the penalty games solo only?
Hmmm... You got a good point there. but even I strongly hate solo queue. So I think at least duo draft would be fine maybe. So make it like rank for the restricted. Solo/Duo Normal Draft.
for some reason, you just confirmed victorious morgana skin. well now that ruins the surprise XD
We've actually known it was Victorious Morgana for about a month now.
Don't be silly...we all know that picture they posted was for victorious {{champion:79}} just take another look

I can't wait to hear my friends reaction when he doesnt get the rewards :D 
Thanks Riot!
So Victorious Morgana confirmed? Thanks, Riot! ...Not that I'll get gold.

To anyone complaining about this obvious attempt on Riot's part to fix our toxic community: shut up already. The only reason you could possibly be complaining is because you are TOXIC. If you complain for ANY reason in chat YOU ARE TOXIC. That is the very behavior Riot is trying to curtail. There is NO POSSIBLE VALID REASON to complain in chat. Chat is for coordinating with your team, not for you to vent because you don't like something. Chat is not a way for you to tell someone how bad you think they are, because trust me: if someone is bad THEY know it. They obviously do not need you to tell them their 0-10-15 game was bad(barring support play). The only things you should provide are calls, tips(minus the cursing/flaming), or praise.

> To anyone complaining about this obvious attempt on Riot's part to fix our toxic community: shut up already. The only reason you could possibly be complaining is because you are TOXIC. If you complain for ANY reason in chat YOU ARE TOXIC. 

Or you are an habitual Normal Draft player, who will now have to cope with the scum expelled from ranked games. 
This is a long term plan, I know. They expect that, in the long run, people who will no longer be able to play ranked due to their toxicity will either quit or reform, but it's bad for the Normal Draft player who will have to play the role of unwilling prison guards.

>When Ranked Restrictions go live on NA and EU, restricted players will be unable to queue up for ranked until they complete a certain number of games in Normal Draft

Doesn't this basically turn normal draft into a prisoners island? I thought you guys were against that idea. I'd be interested in hearing what changed your minds, or how this is different. 

Don't get me wrong though, I like this idea and I'm glad you guys are working on improving the ranked experience.

Prisoner's island this isn't. Prisoner's island is where you force toxic people to play with only toxic people. By forcing them to play with nontoxic people they either have to improve or learn to care less about the game because they can't ever play ranked again.
I love this idea! Might actually help  me win some ranked games {{item:3151}} {{item:3070}} i cry everytime ;-;

With the fact that alot of people who get punished are players who are actually passionate about the game... you'll probably get more relaxed players who dont care if they win or lose.  So its a toss up.

Only 1% of the player base are "passionate" enough to get punished. There's a lot more people in Ranked who aren't so "passionate" they have to tell somebody they will hunt him, they will find him, and they will kill him.

you are generalizing.  not every person in that 1% makes harmful threats.  And that generalization is what is wrong with these punishment systems.  You'd assume a thief was a murderer if you saw them both in jail.

Well, as right now, thief's and murderers both ARE in jails, I suppose you are wrong? And Lyte specifically said that 1% of the player base are so toxic that people feel harmed by them. THAT is the difference here: Some people are only midly toxic once in a while and never get punished. The ones who get punished are the worst of the worst, not only some not-so-bad people who who rage once in a while

so the guy who murders once is the same as the guy who steals often?

The intensity of said rage is so wide because they added frequency to the equation.  You can be mildly toxic in a majority of games, little rage here and there per game, get reported, then get punished.  Or you can be so violently toxic and yell death threats and get the same punishment.  Again... the thief and the murderer, are being treated the same in this context.

> so the guy who murders once is the same as the guy who steals often?

Who's forcing words down another person's mouth now? No, they are not the same, yet they get thrown into jail all the same.

> 
> The intensity of said rage is so wide because they added frequency to the equation.  You can be mildly toxic in a majority of games, little rage here and there per game, get reported, then get punished.  Or you can be so violently toxic and yell death threats and get the same punishment.  Again... the thief and the murderer, are being treated the same in this context.

Well, it doesn't matter if you only killed one person because you were momentarily angry or robbed five hundred houses over a twenty year period, either way you're going into jail for a very long time. Doesn't mean that people look at those two guys the same way, it's just that they don't want either of them around.

and what of the people who steal to survive?
there is a difference and it is thrown out of context.  they are given the wrong tools or poor tools and go back to their old habits.  If you are going to make a player's behavior your problem, you should make their reform your problem also.

> and what of the people who steal to survive?
> there is a difference and it is thrown out of context.  they are given the wrong tools or poor tools and go back to their old habits.  If you are going to make a player's behavior your problem, you should make their reform your problem also.

This is the mentality of entitled youth. IF you steal it is YOUR problem, and YOU should be made to deal with the consequences. Just like in Riot's idea, your negativity or toxicity is made into YOUR problem. The ranked q is a place for teamwork and skill, additionally your own team should not in any way contribute to tilt. You are supposed to work TOGETHER not try and break each other down. Constructive feedback is vastly different from cussing at someone, calling them names, or saying how bad/stupid they are.
Why did you just make up a random statistic?
